availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Paducah, McCracken County, Kentucky retired merchant. Virginia native. Married Adella J. Enders. Father of Sarah A. Enders, Franklin H. Enders, Geraldine Enders, and Davidella Enders. Held nine slaves in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken County, Division 1, p. 142. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken County, Division 1, p. 447. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken County, District 2, Paducah, p. 101. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken County, District 2, Paducah, p. 16. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken County, Paducah, p. 35. Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Mortality Schedules, Kentucky, p. 446.
